Articles.Content:
Build a fully working Space Shuttle that can construct a space station in under an hour. (Time does not matter in the building and testing process)

Easy mode-10 part space station under an hour, and any mods you wish except hyper edit.

Medium mode-20 part space station under an hour, and 5 mods of your liking except hyper edit.

Hard mode-30 part space station under an hour, and no mods whatsoever.

Post pictures of your time, shuttle, and space station so I can see if you completed the challenge or not.

Person who wins gets a cookie!

P.S: I forgot to mention that you can only bring up two modules at a time.

Edited January 20, 2016 by Kerbonaut.Bacon

7 hours ago, Kerbonaut.Bacon said:

Build a fully working Space Shuttle that can construct a space station in under an hour. (Time does not matter in the building and testing process)

What does it mean "construct a space station"? Spacecrafts can construct things now in KSP? Or do you mean to use the Interplanetary Launchpad mod?

Have you completed that challenge yourself, or at least tried?

Yes I have completed the challenge and have had a shuttle in my space program for at least 6 months in real time now.

And what I mean by construct a space station is, is by bringing up parts in the shuttles cargo bay.

On 1/20/2016 at 11:58 PM, Bev7787 said:

All stock?

Yes, all stock for hard mode.

Score based on part count can very easily be exploited. Just add a lot of small light weight parts and you get over 30 before you know it. Score based on mass is a much better and more difficult to exploit.

Why the two modules per launch limit? A single module can be a perfectly realistic station. A cupola, a lab, some solar panels and batteries, an antenna and a docking port. Add a few dozen science experiments and you'll have a 30+ part science station. I WIN!

On 1/20/2016 at 4:23 PM, Tex_NL said:

Score based on part count can very easily be exploited. Just add a lot of small light weight parts and you get over 30 before you know it. Score based on mass is a much better and more difficult to exploit.

Why the two modules per launch limit? A single module can be a perfectly realistic station. A cupola, a lab, some solar panels and batteries, an antenna and a docking port. Add a few dozen science experiments and you'll have a 30+ part science station. I WIN!

Thanks for that information, it was my first challenge and I was quite bored at the time so I just wrote a challenge just to let people have some fun. Wasn't really thinking about the exploits and stuff.
